answers.answer: Go back to the orthopedic specialist who said you should have back surgery.  Whether diabetes figured in or not, he saw the pictures and tried noninvasive treatment, and then opted surgery.  You fell down the stairs, for crying out loud.  Surgery has a good chance of giving you permanent pain relief or at least some help with some of the pain.  Opiates are a good alternative to the Lyrica you've been getting, by the way... and also, you could go up to 450mg on the Lyrica before they should declare it unhelpful.  Now, I hope you will also go back to the person treating your diabetes, and make sure you are receiving adequate treatment for that, just have them look you over again.  In the end, if better pain relief and better diabetic control turn the tide, then of course avoid surgery.  But let the orthopedist help you with that decision, in regards to positive long-term prognosis with your condition.

title: Femoral neuropathy and lumbar injury
